bow: is it normal to cry when you look at your child just has my son days ago and multiple times day when holding him ll just start crying it like sad and happy at the same time he is so amazing and love him so much it brings me to tears he so perfect wouldn say sad and depressed but it kind of feels that way little sort of like oh my god he almost week old time needs to slow down already but on the other hand am so excited for our lives together and everything that is in store for us anyone else feel this way am crazy completely normal your feelings right now should be like you re going on crazy rollercoaster when had my first was terrified elated sad excited frustrated etc congratulations to you and your baby boy my boy is almost 12 days old and still cry everyday people always ask are you okay and like am so overwhelmed with the amount of love feel and unsure of how to process it cry thinking it almost been week already don want him to grow up so fast hot mess congrats to you by the way glad im not alone my son is next month even though my pregnancy was hard and even though have ppd still and have had rough go at momming it look at him probably once day and cry because love him so much miss his little baby face and see it transforming every day into little boy you re totally normal this is completely normal behavior you still have all of those pregnancy hormones when my daughter was born would lay her down so could shower and miss her so much being away 10 minutes my daughter turned one and still an emotional wreck half the time it gets little better as they get older more in the sense that you ll cry for the milestones they accomplish in the 1st year hang in there mama just know that you are doing great yes this happened to me every time nursed both my babies hormones and being new mother are strange combo listen to your body take care of yourself not just your baby and enjoy every moment they do grow up fast it the longest shortest time of our lives so normal my baby is almost 7mos and still cry pretty regularly not lot at once but when think of how much she grown and changed so quickly and how much she means to me can help but cry some just to add there no way you should feel right now some people feel like they re on crazy rollercoaster others might feel total lack of feelings for their baby at this point both are normal there are lot of hormones going on plus whatever positive or negative birth experience you may have had sounds like you have new love op enjoy it ❤️ totally felt the same way was told partly it the hormones partly your body trying to get rid of all the extra fluids hehe and imagine this is probably nature making sure you take care of the baby felt such intense love like nothing else compared to it immediately felt like would do absolutely anything including dying if it needed for my baby that why started bed sharing because could stay being away from him and it actually helped me sleep better know it not for everyone and if you choose to do it you should follow safe bed sharing guidelines but man it sure made my heart be more at peace how old is he my son is two and half and still sometimes tear up when look at him this made me smile congratulations on your new bundle of joy it totally normal to be so overwhelmed by the love your hormones are flooding your body it will settle down eventually bless you so so normal ♥️ yes omg lost count of the number of times spontaneously burst into tears in the days after had my son it just such wild life change and surge of hormones and complete disbelief that you made this little squishy person this is all totally normal take good care of yourself during these days take all the help you can ♥️ my son is months old and still tear up on daily basis my son is 15 months old and sometimes cry looking at him for the same reasons you listed completely normal it honestly never goes away find myself crying all the time at things my girls do they had their dance recital last weekend and it was the first for my youngest was ugly crying the whole time my son is months and ca stop cuddling and kissing him did think it was possible to love something so much sounds like new mom feels to me wept about once or twice day sometimes during the first month cause his little face was so perfect and the world was so hard if you get worried about mood swings you can always talk to your doctor about it and get screened for ppd call it sad love it so strange but normal congratulations yes normal as ever my little guy is gon na be 17 months soon and look at him and cry children are just so beautiful and sit there and think to my self wow created this perfect little human ❤️ my son is five and still feel this way it so exciting to watch them grow but also want to roll back time the plight of mama the time right after giving birth is so crazy cried at the smallest things for the first two weeks postpartum they call it the baby blues it totally normal yes it normal sometimes this still happens to me with the three year old he told me he loved me unprompted and came to get hug cried that feeling hasn ever gone away for me even with the kids who are older—it just changes slightly over time and almost imperceptibly shifts day by day into feeling of pride and happiness for who they are becoming totally normal at days pp it normal to cry about anything but yes it totally normal to feel like that especially that bittersweet feeling of being excited to watch him grow and being sad that he growing up my son is 15 months now and still get really emotional sometimes when think about how big he is and how such short time ago he was just little smoosh sleeping in my arms do think that feeling ever goes away although it lot less intense now without those lovely pp hormones amplifying all my feelings cried would say out of 24 hours daily for the first weeks was sad happy angry excited everything all at once gt is it normal to cry when you look at your child ~~no that weird ~~ gt just has my son days ago yes totally normal when had my first cried looking at my husband holding him and then cried because was crying for about weeks pp was on an emotional roller coaster didn have too many mood swings whilst preggo but definitely did postpartum wanted to say the same thing think it normal part of motherhood that mama bear love is so strong it brings you to tears totally normal hormones take about weeks after birth to return to normal everyday can be different from crying out of happiness to crying from lack of sleep to crying for absolutely no reason whatsoever make sure to ask for help when needed and remind people that you re still adjusting mentally while there are days of pure bliss there are also days of frustration and not understanding why you don feel normal yet just know that it ok to ask for help or even nap now have an yo yo and month old still cry out of happiness sometimes just looking at hormones are unreal ok so do this every time hold baby and not even close to becoming mom 21 bf and want to wait at least another years yet every time hold babies look at them and just cry because feelings especially since now you have those pregnancy hormones and everything you go woman you re amazing and keep on showering this baby with love you ll be okay❤️ ah those postpartum hormones baby love him more than anything but cried lot you got this girl congrats know ll cry when everyone meets my baby so hope they re all ready for it lol my kids are almost years and 18 months respectively and still get this feeling on occasion the other thing to keep in mind is your body is still flooded with all those hormones from pregnancy and birth and those do number on your emotions it mostly perfectly normal the important thing to watch out for is if you start feeling totally overwhelmed or depressed or anything of that nature which means you could be falling into postpartum depression struggled with that with my first born and ended up getting hormone shots which helped great deal yes my son is almost and the other night just watched him sleep and bawled my eyes out kids are the
